concise_definition: adj. 费力的, 紧张的, 令人吃力的; v. (strain 的现在分词) 拉紧, 过度使用, 筛选

definitions.explanation_en: Describing something that requires great effort, causes tension, or is mentally or physically exhausting.
definitions.explanation_cn: 形容某事物需要极大的努力，造成紧张，或在精神或身体上令人精疲力竭。
definitions.example_en: The straining silence after the announcement made everyone uneasy.
definitions.example_cn: 公告后的紧张沉默让每个人都感到不安。

definitions.explanation_en: To exert force or pressure beyond normal limits, often resulting in stress, damage, or extreme effort.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指施加超出正常限度的力量或压力，常导致压力、损伤或极度费力。
definitions.example_en: He was straining to lift the heavy box, his muscles trembling.
definitions.example_cn: 他竭尽全力抬起沉重的箱子，肌肉都在颤抖。

definitions.explanation_en: To filter or pass a liquid or mixture through a mesh or porous material to separate solids from liquids.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过网状或多孔材料过滤液体或混合物，以分离固体与液体。
definitions.example_en: She was straining the broth to remove the herbs and spices.
definitions.example_cn: 她正在过滤汤，以去除香草和香料。

definitions.explanation_en: To stretch or extend something to its limit, often to the point of breaking or distorting.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指将某物拉伸或延伸至极限，常达到断裂或变形的程度。
definitions.example_en: The bridge was straining under the weight of the overloaded trucks.
definitions.example_cn: 这座桥在超载卡车的重压下岌岌可危。

comparison.analysis: “Stressing”（强调/施压）侧重于心理或情感上的压力，常用于表达对某事的重视或焦虑，如“stressing the importance of safety”。而 “straining” 更强调物理或生理上的过度用力或承受极限，带有更明显的身体负担感。
“Filtering”（过滤）是中性术语，泛指任何分离固体与液体的过程，可使用多种工具或方法。而 “straining” 特指使用筛网、布或类似工具进行粗略过滤，常用于厨房或日常语境，带有更具体、更手工化的含义。
“Exerting”（施加）泛指使用力量、努力或影响，可以是温和或持续的，如“exerting influence”。而 “straining” 暗示力量已接近或超过极限，带有紧张、吃力甚至危险的语义色彩，强度更高。
